content.description:
This route climbs the slab just left of where it meets with the overhang. Mostly used as a means to access the climbs on the overhang.



Follows the slab near where it meets the overhang

bolts, bolted anchor.

This route climbs the tallest part of the impressive overhang. 

Where the slab meets the overhang, climb up a corner (often dirty and wet) to gain a stance on a small sloping ledge. Stem up the corner before moving right (crux) to gain the apex of an undercling feature. Follow the right facing corner system to a slabby ledge and good rest. Move slightly right then back left into a flaring chimney. Contort up the chimney to gain better holds. Big moves on good holds take you to the anchor.



Starts in the corner directly below the large overhang (far right of the slabby wall).

almost entirely perma draws with aluminum biners. First 2 bolts don't have perma draws. chain anchor with aluminum quick clips.

climbs.name: End of the Line
climbs.fa: P. Adamson, F. Corbett, A. Manley 2020

content.description:
Start by jamming or laybacking some gently overhanging cracks, make a few hard moves, then pull the lip to the anchor. This line was bolted due to utopia's questionable rock quality.



Leftmost route on the overhang, belay from the Cat in the Hat anchor.

5 bolts, rap rings

Climb up a right angling weakness to a good stance. Move up a bit from this stance then step left onto the face (St. George's Hole breaks off right). Follow the pumpy face to the top.



From the Big Utopia overhanging wall, move slightly right around the cliff and around a corner. This is the first bolted line on the left side of the vertical face.

bolts. bolted anchor

Climb up the slab for a few bolts. At a sloping ledge, move slightly right onto the face and continue up interesting and pumpy climbing on questionable rock.



Starts down and right from Send Badge/Way of the Road, on the slab immediately left of the arête rounding the corner to the face.

bolts, rap ring anchor.

Climb up past a tricky section and into the large diagonal weakness on the wall. Follow it up and right a bit then clip a bolt on the face above. Move left onto the upper face to a stance. From here you can either climb left of the bolts or make a move to the right and climb right of the bolts. Finish up a notch at the top of the cliff.



Second line of bolts on the lower face right of the large Sunnyvale overhangs. 

many bolts. rap rings

Climb up an easy slab then move up and left. Navigate your way around a hanging block (crux) in order to get established in the large flaring groove. Stem and chimney your way up the steep groove then exit it on the right and continue up the face to the anchors.



Start a few metres right of the junction between the slabby wall and the wall with the overhang.

16 bolts, about half of which have perma-draws. Quick clip anchor.

Climb up the right angling weakness shared with Roast Pastry Dick to a stance. Continue up and right on a sloper rail then straight up to a ledge under the roof. Pull over the roof using a vertical crack. Surprisingly pumpy!

This route offers great movement and possibly slightly better rock than its neighbours to the left.



Shares a start with Roast Pastry Dick. Leftmost line of bolts starting on the vertical face around the corner from the big overhangs.

lots of bolts. rap rings

Climb the first two thirds of Cat in the Hat until you reach the perma-drawed flaring chimney on your right. Make tough moves to establish yourself in the chimney and begin the grueling process of shuffling up the corner on smear feet. At the end of the chimney, reach for a jug and recover for the slightly overhanging 5.12 face. Top it off with a mantle guarding the chains.



Take a right towards the flaring chimney two thirds of the way up Cat and the Hat.

16 bolts (mainly perma-drawed), bolted anchor

The leftmost route at Sunnyvale. Start up the short featured vertical section and engage the crux by making some tricky moves to get established on the slab. Once settled, continue up the consistently technical slab to the anchor.



Furthest left route of Sunnyvale.

8 bolts, rap rings

Climb the route up the middle of the slab. Conveniently, the holds get better near the top where the angle of the rock steepens.



In the middle of the slabby wall left of the overhang.

bolts, bolted anchor

Climb the slab clipping the first few bolts of Send Badge but instead of moving left, continue straight up the steep overhang. Make fun moves on good holds until you reach face above. Climb another 10m of 5.10 to quick clips.



Start a few metres right of the junction between the slabby wall and the wall with the overhang.

16 bolts (some permadrawed), quick clips

Utopia wall is home to a very impressive and imposing overhang. Several routes on this overhang climb up flaring grooves and require intricate and unique beta to solve. Most of these routes are accessed by climbing part way up the easy bolted slab (Cat in the Hat) then breaking off onto the overhang. Utopia wall also has a couple slab routes left of the overhang and a tall vertical wall right of the overhang. The rock on the right wall tends to be crumbly so beware.

Utopia wall gets morning sun and afternoon shade
